org.chrisjr.loom.mappings

Interface Mapping<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the return type of the mapping
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ColorMapping, FloatMapping, IntMapping, MidiMessageMapping, ObjectMapping, OscBundleMapping, OscMessageMapping, StatefulCallableMapping

    public interface Mapping<T>
    A Mapping is an interface with one method, call, that returns a single output for a value between 0.0 and 1.0. It may also return null if there is no output associated with a given value.
    Author:
    chrisjr

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T call(double value) 

    • Method Detail

      • call

        T call(double value)
        Parameters:
        value - a real number in the interval [0.0, 1.0]
        Returns:
        the output for that value
